Visualize raw DNA sequences as an image

Source: R/viz_matrix_of_acgt_image.R
viz_seqs_as_acgt_mat_from_seqs.Rd

This function plots the collection of sequences as an image matrix.

viz_seqs_as_acgt_mat_from_seqs(
  rawSeqs,
  position_labels = NULL,
  xt_freq = 5,
  yt_freq = 100,
  col = c("darkgreen", "blue", "orange", "red"),
  savefilename = NULL,
  filetype = "PNG",
  fwidth = 450,
  fheight = 900,
  funits = "px"
)

Arguments

rawSeqs

The sequences as a DNAStringSet object.
position_labels

The labels to be used for the sequence positions. Default: Sequence positions are labeled from 1 to the length of the sequences.
xt_freq

The x-axis tick frequency.
yt_freq

The y-axis tick frequency.
col

A vector of four colors used for the DNA bases A, C, G, and T (in that order)
savefilename

Specify the filename (with extension) for saving the plot to disk
filetype

Specify the file type, namely PNG, JPEG, TIFF.
fwidth

Specify the width for the plot. This depends on the length of sequences.
fheight

Specify the height for the plot. This depends on the number of sequences.
funits

Specify the units in which the height and width are given.

Value

Nothing returned to the R interpreter.

See also

viz_seqs_as_acgt_mat_from_ohe for visualizing one-hot encoded DNA sequences

Other visualization functions: plot_ggheatmap(), plot_ggseqlogo(), viz_basis_vectors_as_heatmap(), viz_basis_vectors_as_seqlogo(), viz_basis_vectors_in_combined_heatmaps_seqlogos(), viz_seqs_as_acgt_mat_from_ohe()
